item.title: [317 PI] ::telenote
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Davidi2:

I dislike the idea of the server-sided screenshot. If you could have it client sided and only capture the game window (which would be done by passing a BufferedImage graphics context to the paint method and then saving that rather than actually screenshotting) then it might be reasonable.

I remember Bluurs client originally had the screenshot button…
You could emulate that easily for this command.

Read full topic

item.title: [317 PI] ::telenote
item.dc:creator: @twins twins
item.description:
@twins wrote:

I think the best thing is that the command will take a screen shot of the client only and name it the X and Y coords and then save it in a specified file.

Read full topic

item.title: [317 PI] ::telenote
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

or you can do the same thing but take a picture instead so you can see what the area looks like (my commands look a bit different but you should be able to figure it out)

[code=java] commands.put(“coords”, new Command() {
@Override
public void execute(Player player, String[] cmd) {
try {
Robot robot = new Robot();

                robot.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_ALT);
                robot.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_PRINTSCREEN);
                robot.keyRelease(KeyEvent.VK_PRINTSCREEN);
                robot.keyRelease(KeyEvent.VK_ALT);

                Thread.sleep(1000 * 2);

                Transferable t = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getSystemClipboard().getContents(null);
                RenderedImage image = (RenderedImage) t.getTransferData(DataFlavor.imageFlavor);

                ImageIO.write(image, "png", new File("./data/coordinates/" + player.absX + "-" + player.absY + ".png"));
            } catch (Exception e) {
                e.printStackTrace();
            }
        }

        @Override
        public int rights() {
            return 3;
        }
    });[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: [317 PI] ::telenote
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:16, topic:513390”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=631636.msg4352226#msg4352226 date=1376858050]
would only be useful for when randomly teleporting and finding locations you’ve never seen/heard of.

would be more useful in a program: load runescape map/align clicking per coordinate (believe 1 pixel is 4 tiles?) and draw tooltips or an icon where a tile has been saved
[/quote]
They had something like this when RSBuddy was around, I can’t remember the name of it (It may still be on pb). It was a .jar of the map and you could like get tile data and find walking paths from point A to B.[/quote]steven released a tool for dementhium he made, which worked exactly as described above (except for saving specific locations like I did, you could save npc spawns through his tool though). don’t believe it’s around anymore though.

item.title: [317 PI] ::telenote
item.dc:creator: @dawsonsmokes dawsonsmokes
item.description:
@dawsonsmokes wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:13, topic:513390”][quote author=dawsonsmokes link=topic=631636.msg4351909#msg4351909 date=1376794581]

Honestly, I’d rather see it wrote into 1 line, so each new tele wasn’t based on 4 lines…

                             if (playerCommand.startsWith("telenote")) {
                                try {
                                    BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./Data/Teleport Ideas.txt", true));
                                        String text = playerCommand.substring(9);
                                            out.write("~Title: " + text + " X: " + c.absX + " Y: " + c.absY + " H: " + c.heightLevel);
                                            out.newline();
                                            out.close();
                                        } catch (IOException e) {
                                    e.printStackTrace();
                                }
                            }

Much better then before +1
[/quote]Sk8r’s new command wouldn’t fix the “problem” (it’s not a problem) you’re having, so I don’t know why you’re +1ing. However, I do agree that it is a lot better on one line than 4.[/quote]

Not using it nor will I use it just something rather pointless for me can be used for others though. If I wanted to make a cords list I would save it to my external hardrive with all my other rsps stuff. Then I would find a real cords list online lol

Read full topic

item.title: [317 PI] ::telenote
item.dc:creator: @The7thSanctum The7thSanctum
item.description:
@The7thSanctum wrote:

relexlawl:

Why do you have a try statement inside a try statement? And more importantly why are you looping through players to write data on a text? You do realize that would keep on writing the information as much as there is players (will write the information 20 times if there are 20 players online, etc)

Good point. I just went over the command.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("telenote")) { try { BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./Data/Teleport Ideas.txt", true)); String text = playerCommand.substring(9); out.newLine(); out.newLine(); out.write("~Title: " + text); out.newLine(); out.write("X: " + c.absX); out.newLine(); out.write("Y: " + c.absY); out.newLine(); out.write("H: " + c.heightLevel); out.close(); } catch (IOException e) { e.printStackTrace(); } }
Any better?

Read full topic

item.title: [317 PI] ::telenote
item.dc:creator: @The7thSanctum The7thSanctum
item.description:
@The7thSanctum wrote:

Well, I was coding and I started getting annoyed when I didn’t save teleport locations that I wanted. So I created a command. This command will write down your X,Y and Height co’ords, with the note you leave. I’ll admit, it’s not made in the best way, I’m learning. I made this 100% by myself.

You would use this command like so:

and in a file called “Teleport Ideas” (which you will need to make in your Data folder, or change the destination), it will look like this:

~Title: This could be home one day. X: Y: H:

Here’s the code.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("telenote")) { try { BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./Data/Teleport Ideas.txt", true)); String text = playerCommand.substring(9); out.newLine(); out.newLine(); out.write("~Title: " + text); out.newLine(); out.write("X: " + c.absX); out.newLine(); out.write("Y: " + c.absY); out.newLine(); out.write("H: " + c.heightLevel); out.close(); } catch (IOException e) { e.printStackTrace(); } }

I know it looks horrible, it might have things it doesn’t need or there could be a better way, but I am still learning. Sorry if it’s offensive ;D.

Enjoy anyway.

Read full topic
